Mind you, there are entire TV series glamorizing, humanizing, and sympathizing White Americans in this exact situation of selling drugs to live - Weeds, Breaking Bad, etc.

But fact is, Black & Brown communities have been in this predicament forever & get called “animals.” /5

¿Todavía tiene preguntas sobre los cheques de reembolso incluidos en el proyecto de ley CARES? 

El sen Rubio lanzó un documento de preguntas frecuentes para explicar qué tipo de asistencia usted y su familia pueden esperar durante el #COVID_19.  Lea más👇

For Black & Brown communities, especially in the era of criminalization, the choice to sell weed of course is a risky one - not just w/ police, but with those you get tied up with.

Yet when a teenage boy believes the other option is homelessness, they may take the chance. /4

Still have questions about the recovery rebates included in the #CARESAct? 

Senator Rubio released an FAQ document to help explain what type of assistance you and your family can expect amid #COVID_19. Read more 👇

It’s virtually impossible to pay rent on $8/hr.

And when you are teenage boy in a fatherless home (his dad passed away), there is a drive to be “the man of the house.” To help your mom.

And what makes money fast when a full time job doesn’t pay enough to live? Selling weed. /3

Nothing is more important than the safety of our children. 

In the middle of the #coronavirus crisis, we can ensure that America’s children will be safe with an actionable plan – not magical thinking. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1282718615406600192/pu/img/txuLcpOSGTjoJTYH.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1282718615406600192/pu/vid/480x270/-j372dpznDl8_gK6.mp4?tag=10

Let me give you a real life example that I’ve encountered often (wording vaguely to protect people).

Growing up I was friends w/ a boy who was the son of a single mom. They struggled to pay rent.

As we know, hourly work doesn’t pay a living wage - especially then. /2

Grateful to the crew of @LHD6BHR USS Bonhomme Richard and all those working to stop this devastating fire. @NavBaseSD sailors work tirelessly for our nation’s security, at great risk to their lives.

Republicans are all upset that I’m connecting the dots between poverty and crime.

I know most of them haven’t experienced or seen these issues first hand, but I have.

This may be hard for them to admit, but poverty and crime are highly linked, both violent & nonviolent alike. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1282502759388819457 QT @thehill Rep. @AOC: "Crime is a symptom of a diseased society that neglects its most marginalized people, and we do not solve that problem with police." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EcvcHbIWkAEcFq8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1282360022320779264/vid/480x270/eUvU8BVCnZBIWyr1.mp4?tag=13

Evictions may soon leave ~28M homeless in the United States. We are on the verge of a wave of evictions if Congress doesn’t swiftly act to ban evictions and foreclosures during the pandemic—and pass my bill to provide $2,000 monthly payments. Time is of the essence.

RT @RepJayapal Forcing international students to leave their campuses and threatening to deport them serves absolutely no purpose—outside of soothing Trump’s xenophobic ego.

I joined 100 of my colleagues in calling on ICE & DHS to immediately withdraw this cruel policy. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/99-members-congress-demand-withdrawal-restrictions-international-students-n1233358

It’s our real life.

While it takes months, sometimes years to study crime data, I personally can tell you that fed & state relief is NOT reaching people.

We aren’t getting stimulus checks (mixed status fams), millions can’t pay rent, & summer youth employment has been cut. /7

I take this issue seriously. Unlike many of GOP pundits theorizing from suburban homes, I’ve had multiple family members shot, shot at, stabbed, etc.

Crime + community violence isn’t some thought experiment to project your thoughts & theories abt communities you’ve never met. /6

"Chinese officials announced sanctions against Cruz...Cruz has been one of the most vocal critics of China in recent years, blaming the country for the #CoronavirusPandemic & accusing the country of human rights abuses" via @dcexaminer's @DomMastrangelo1. https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/bummer-ted-cruz-mocks-chinese-sanctions-against-him-and-other-republicans

Congress needs to get to the bottom of whether Russia placed bounties on American soldiers in Afghanistan. We need full access any relevant presidential briefing materials.

And the Trump administration must testify before Congress in an open hearing.

It’s not as though a vote happens and the full sum of money disappears the next day. That not how it works.

People who study crime know that (despite how many pundits pretend otherwise), *causes of crime are complex* and there are few neat and tidy causal relationships.

None of these policing reductions have even *happened yet.*

So a spike is happening WITH a $6 billion dollar NYPD budget.

You either know this & are intentionally lying, or you‘re a bad spokeswoman & haven’t verified your claims.

Given your work with @NRA it’s probably both. https://twitter.com/dloesch/status/1282737265689661441 QT @DLoesch Crime is up because you and others pushed for a reduction in both policing and penalities. Also, whenever you want to talk about poverty, I’m happy to tell you about how hard it was for my single mom and me when I was growing up — and it wasn’t in tony *Westchester.* https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1282717454993707010

Under the ACA, insurers are required to cover women's essential health care services. Donald Trump is trying to take that away—all in the midst of a pandemic that has left women disproportionately vulnerable. 

Our health care is on the line this November.

This is a great piece by @Sebelius.

Donald Trump wants to take us back to the days when insurers could deny women health coverage and charge them more just for being women.
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/13/opinion/obamacare-aca-trump-women.html?action=click&module=Opinion&pgtype=Homepage

The US has the full authority to invoke the UN snapback mechanism and restore international sanctions on Iran. The decades-old "double veto" ensures there is nothing procedural to block the snapback. https://twitter.com/rich_goldberg/status/1282693540557004800 QT @rich_goldberg It's called a "double veto" and it might be the US "ace in the hole" at the UN Security Council to force the "snapback" of UN sanctions on Iran. Check out this new FAQ to learn about the coming debate and why Russia/China have no way to stop a US snapback. https://www.fdd.org/in-the-news/2020/07/09/faq-the-snapback-of-un-sanctions-on-iran/

There are more than 35M people living with a disability who are eligible to vote. But too often voting is inaccessible. This National Disability Voter Registration Week, I’m calling on Congress to pass my VoteSafe Act to make voting in the age of coronavirus accessible for all.

We cannot afford this Administration’s willful ignorance about what needs to be done to keep our children safe and defeat the #coronavirus. 

They need to catch up or get out of the way. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1282755595456610307/pu/img/YCszYon84nqF0kIj.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1282755595456610307/pu/vid/480x270/53X9uYh0La4h_toT.mp4?tag=10

For example, I have heard employers say “we already offer great benefits, why bother unionizing?”

We offered great benefits too - many of which were ratified in our contract!

A union can also:
a) Protect these benefits, &/or
b) Establish impt non-monetary rights & protections

It’s been 5 years since Sandra Bland died in police custody after being arrested for a failure to signal a lane change. Sandra should still be with us today. We will not stop fighting for her until we get justice. #SayHerName http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ec1B3VQWoAIroOB.jpg

This whole process was really eye-opening & I learned a lot!

As a nonprofit employee & a waitress, I always worked in right-to-work places. Seeing the power of a union up close was inspiring.

I also gained insight into anti-union arguments, which is helpful for countering them.

...la ayuda estatal y de emergencia NO está llegando a las personas.

No estamos recibiendo cheques de estímulo (familias de estatus mixto), millones no pueden pagar la renta y el empleo de verano para los jóvenes ha reducido

10/10

Ni el crimen ni la violencia comunitaria son un experimento mental para proyectar pensamientos y teorías sobre comunidades que nunca has conocido.

Es nuestra vida real. 

Claro, puede tomar meses o años, estudiar los datos de delitos, pero personalmente puedo decir que...

9/10

Me tomo este problema muy en serio. A diferencia de muchos expertos republicanos que teorizan desde sus hogares suburbanos, yo tengo familiares que han sido baleados, apuñalados, etc. 

8/10

Incluso, existen series de TV que cautivan, humanizan y simpatizan a estadounidenses blancos que venden drogas para sobrevivir: Weeds, Breaking Bad, etc.

La verdad es que las comunidades de color han estado en esta situación por mucho tiempo pero se les llama "animales". 

7/10

...no solo con la policía, sino que también con las personas que te involucras. 

Pero cuando un joven piensa que la otra alternativa es quedarse sin hogar, es posible verse presionado a asumir el riesgo. 

6/10

¿Y cómo se hace el dinero rápido cuando un trabajo de tiempo completo no paga lo suficiente para sobrevivir? Vendiendo marihuana. 

Para las comunidades de color, especialmente en la era de la criminalización, la opción de vender marihuana, por supuesto, es un riesgo..

5/10

Es prácticamente imposible pagar la renta con $ 8 / hora.

Y cuando eres un adolescente en una casa sin un padre (su papá falleció), hay un deseo por ser "el hombre de la casa"... y ayudar a tu mamá. 

4/10

Permíteme darte un ejemplo de la vida real(detalles resumidos para proteger a personas).

Cuando estaba pequeña, yo era amiga de un niño que era hijo de una madre soltera. Era difícil para ellos pagar la renta.

Como sabemos, el trabajo por hora no paga un salario digno... 

3/10

Puede ser difícil para ellos admitirlo, pero la pobreza y el crimen están altamente vinculados, tanto los crímenes violentos como los no violentos.

 2/10

Los republicanos están molestos porque estoy conectando los puntos entre la pobreza y el crimen.

Sé que la mayoría de ellos no han vivido o visto estos problemas de primera mano, pero yo sí. 

1/10 https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1282502759388819457 QT @thehill Rep. @AOC: "Crime is a symptom of a diseased society that neglects its most marginalized people, and we do not solve that problem with police." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EcvcHbIWkAEcFq8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1282360022320779264/vid/480x270/eUvU8BVCnZBIWyr1.mp4?tag=13
